hecbayes 2023.10.15
  • Reference

    Electoral participation

    voting.Rd

    Data from a Ipsos survey commissioned by FiveThirtyEight to study determinant of electoral participation during national elections. Data have been coupled with census registers and weighted to reflect the US population as a whole. For more details, consult the description and the survey questionaire. Data were used in the article Why Millions of Americans Don't Vote.

    voting

    Format

    A data frame with 5836 rows and 8 variables:

    age

    [integer] age of respondant

    race

    [factor] race, one of black, hispanic, other/mixed or white

    gender

    [factor] gender, either male or female

    income

    [factor] income category

    vote

    [ordered] frequency of vote in national election, either rarely/never, sporadic or always

    educ

    [factor] education level of respondent

    weight

    [double] sampling weight

    party

    [factor] party affiliation, either Democrat (Dem), Republican (GOP) or other for non-response, independent, third party or no preference

    Source

    FiveThirtyEight, `non-voters` data

    Note

    Data shared under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License
